title: Why Does Israel Keep Having So Many Elections?
description: A divided electorate and shifting alliances make for a delicate balance in the country’s voting outcomes and lawmakers’ ability to hold diverse blocs together.
dc:creator: Patrick Kingsley
media:credit: Amit Elkayam for The New York Times
media:description: Israel’s voters remain evenly split on the question of whether Benjamin Netanyahu is fit to run the country while standing trial on corruption charges related to bribery, fraud and breach of trust.
